overview.title: September-October 2025 Federal Data Erasure Wave
overview.scope: Over 8,000 web pages and approximately 3,000 datasets removed or modified across multiple federal agencies
overview.primary_mechanism: Executive orders followed by agency compliance directives

cases.title: National Institute of Justice White Supremacist Violence Study Deletion
cases.agency: Department of Justice - National Institute of Justice
cases.content_removed: Study showing white supremacist and far-right violence were the most common forms of terrorism and domestic violent extremism in the United States
cases.mechanism: Website deletion without announcement or archive
cases.impact: Elimination of federally-funded research documenting patterns of domestic terrorism; prevents evidence-based policy on extremism
sources: Wikipedia: 2025 United States government online resource removals

cases.title: USDA Household Food Insecurity Survey Termination
cases.content_removed: Annual household food insecurity survey and all historical data
cases.mechanism: Official termination announced via press release, labeled survey as 'redundant'
cases.impact: Eliminates primary national measure of hunger; creates blind spot for researchers and food assistance advocates; prevents accountability on food access
sources: AP News: Trump administration ends government's annual report on hunger (Sept 20, 2025)
USDA Press Release: USDA Terminates Redundant Food Insecurity Survey (Sept 20, 2025)
cases.related_context: Termination occurred amid broader cuts to food assistance programs and nutrition research

cases.title: Career Census Economist Replaced with Political Appointee
cases.mechanism: Career Deputy Director Ron Jarmin replaced as acting Director by George Cook, Trump political appointee with no prior government experience or advanced training in statistics/economics
cases.impact: Politicization of statistical agency ahead of 2030 Census; loss of institutional expertise; threatens data integrity and independence
cases.context: Cook simultaneously serves as acting Undersecretary for Economic Affairs (which oversees Census) and chief of staff to same role - unprecedented concentration of authority
sources: Center on Budget and Policy Priorities: Federal Data Are Disappearing (Sept 29, 2025)

cases.title: Termination of Statistical Agency Advisory Groups
cases.mechanism: Mass termination of external advisory committees providing expertise on survey design and methodology
cases.impact: Isolates statistical agencies from scientific community expertise at critical juncture for census preparation and survey modernization; eliminates external quality control
sources: Center on Budget and Policy Priorities report (Sept 29, 2025)

cases.title: National Climate Assessments Deletion & USGCRP Shutdown
cases.content_removed: All previously published National Climate Assessments (Congressionally mandated quadrennial reports); entire USGCRP website
cases.mechanism: 'Denial by erasure' strategy outlined in Project 2025 training videos
cases.impact: Loss of primary federal climate science synthesis; prevents public and policymaker access to climate data; inhibits accountability on environmental issues
cases.before_after_documentation: National Security Archive Climate Change Transparency Project documented with screenshots
sources: National Security Archive: Disappearing Data Part II (Sept 30, 2025)

cases.title: Government Shutdown Data Blackout
cases.mechanism: Government shutdown halts all official economic data collection and release
suspended_datasets: All Bureau of Labor Statistics releases
cases.impact: Federal Reserve and policymakers operating without critical economic indicators during period of economic uncertainty; private firms attempting to fill gaps with less comprehensive data
cases.context: Shutdown occurs amid unusual economic uncertainty; private sector data (like ADP employment) cannot replace government statistics' comprehensiveness
sources: Washington Post: Government shutdown halts economic data (Oct 9, 2025)
Associated Press: Federal shutdown cuts off economic data (Oct 1, 2025)

cases.title: Bureau of Labor Statistics Sample Reductions Due to 'Limited Resources'
cases.mechanism: Federal hiring freeze led to suspension/reduction of CPI data collection; restricted-use dataset access suspended
cases.suspended_data: Portions of Consumer Price Index data collection; all but one restricted-use research dataset
cases.impact: Reduced quality of inflation measurements affecting Social Security COLA adjustments, food assistance, housing subsidies for millions; researchers lose access to detailed economic data
cases.context: CPI informs cost-of-living adjustments for federal benefits; any data quality reduction directly affects benefit levels
sources: Bureau of Labor Statistics announcements (April, July 2025)
Center on Budget and Policy Priorities report (Sept 29, 2025)

cases.title: DOJ Study on Undocumented Immigrant Crime Rates Deleted
cases.content_removed: Study showing undocumented immigrants commit less crime than citizens
cases.mechanism: Page deletion without replacement or explanation
cases.impact: Removes evidence contradicting administration narrative on immigration and crime; prevents evidence-based immigration policy discussion
sources: Wikipedia: 2025 United States government online resource removals

cases.title: South Korea Government Data Center Fire (International Comparison Case)
cases.mechanism: Battery fire at National Information Resources Service data center
cases.data_lost: 858TB of government data, including all G-Drive (Government Drive) employee documents - 96 systems completely destroyed
cases.backup_status: No backup system existed; officials stated 'G-Drive couldn't have a backup system due to its large capacity'
cases.impact: Permanent loss of government documentation; demonstrates catastrophic failure of data preservation when backups deemed 'too expensive'
cases.relevance: Parallel case showing data vulnerability is global; highlights critical importance of backup systems and data rescue efforts
sources: Slashdot: 858TB of Government Data May Be Lost (Oct 8, 2025)

targeting_criteria: Gender identity and LGBTQ+ health information
Climate change and environmental justice data
Studies showing right-wing extremism as primary domestic threat
Public health research (vaccines, HIV/AIDS, long COVID)
affected_agencies: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (3,000+ pages)
Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (150+ pages)
erasure_techniques: Dataset removal from data.gov and agency portals
Survey termination eliminating future data collection
Replacement of career scientists with political appointees
Labeling critical datasets as 'redundant' before deletion

legal_challenges.outcome: Federal judge issued restraining order Feb 11, 2025 requiring HHS, CDC, FDA to restore certain websites

If you're going to do replicable, reproducible science, you need access to the data.
scientist_response.attribution: Nancy Krieger, Professor of Social Epidemiology, Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health

long_term_implications.scientific_impact: Breaks chain of replicability; future researchers cannot verify or build on government-funded studies; international scientific community loses trust in U.S. data integrity
long_term_implications.policy_impact: Evidence-based policymaking becomes impossible without baseline data; creates information asymmetry favoring administration narratives
long_term_implications.democratic_accountability: Public cannot evaluate government performance without access to data on hunger, crime, extremism, climate, health outcomes
long_term_implications.economic_consequences: Federal Reserve and markets operating with incomplete information; benefit calculations (Social Security COLA, SNAP, housing subsidies) may be compromised by degraded data quality
long_term_implications.precedent_setting: Establishes that incoming administrations can selectively erase predecessor's scientific findings; creates 'institutional amnesia' every 4-8 years

warning_signs: Sudden 404 errors on previously stable government URLs
Replacement of career agency heads with political appointees lacking relevant expertise
Surveys labeled 'redundant' despite being sole source for specific metrics
Removal of 'controversial' topic areas (DEI, climate, gender) before other content
Government shutdowns coinciding with scheduled data releases
preservation_priorities: Datasets used for federal benefit calculations
Long-running time series (decades of comparable data)
Unique data with no alternative sources
Studies cited in pending litigation or policy debates

meta_analysis.pattern_type: Coordinated institutional erasure through multiple mechanisms
meta_analysis.scale: Unprecedented in modern U.S. history - over 11,000 pages/datasets in 9 months
meta_analysis.reversibility: Partial - some content restored via court order, but survey terminations create permanent gaps in time series
meta_analysis.international_context: Parallels authoritarian information control tactics; distinguishes from accidental data loss (cf. South Korea fire) by intentionality and selectivity
meta_analysis.relationship_to_other_cases: Part of broader pattern including Pentagon press restrictions, DACOWITS disbanding, and selective enforcement of speech norms
